required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Appetite Satisfaction and Short-term Satiety of Different Plant Compositions in the Adolescent Age Group
clinical_study.official_title: Effect on Appetite Satisfaction and Short-term Satiety of Different Plant Compositions in the Adolescent Age Group

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the satiating effect of two types of food supplements made from various types of fibres in the subsequent intake of other foods, in satiety, and in the regulation of hormones

detailed_description.textblock: This study assessing the effect on appetite satisfaction and short-term satiety of different plant compositions in the adolescent age segment wants to assess the satiating effect of two types of food supplements made with various types of fibers (inulin, maltodextrins, guar gum and dehydrated plums) in the subsequent intake of other foods, in satiety, and in the regulation of hormones (ghrelin, leptin and insulin) and other peptides involved in the mechanisms of satiety

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of satiety using objective methods (blood analysis)
primary_outcome.description: Biochemistry : glucose, urea, BUN, creatinin (all in mg/dL)

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of satiety using a subjective method (visual analogue scale)
primary_outcome.description: The perceived feeling of satiety will be measured using the 100mm "Visual Analogue Scale" labeled at a far end with a "mark" to the left of "extremely hungry", and on the other with an "extremely satiated"."

arm_group.description: Fiber product: Inulin, maltodextrin, gum guar, plum powder

intervention.description: Fiber product with inulin, maltodextrin, gum guar and plum powder.
Placebo product with maltodextrin and plum powder

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women between 15 and 30 years old.
- Subjects with IMC<25 kg/m2
- Subjects who have a habit of having breakfast, lunch and dinner every day
- Subjects who are willing to comply with the study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects taht are taking any medicines that affect the appetite or food intake
- Presence of endocrine-metabolic diseases
- Eating disorders
- Subjects who are following a special diet
- Subjects who have changed their body weight by more than 10% in the last three months prior to the study
- Subjects who follow a restrictive dietary pattern such as vegetarians, gluten-free diets, weight loss diets, etc.

facility.name: GENUD Research Group, Universidad de Zaragoza
